title: For Sale:  WWI German M1915 Uniform Tunic 1917 Dated
postcontent: Rare and complete German uniform tunic, 1917 dated, as issued to Prussian Garde units. This tunic displays collar litzen and shoulder boards designating assignment to the 2nd Regiment, or the 2nd Garde. These units were used by the Kaiser as personal body guard units, and were some of the first complete units designated and trained as "Storm Troopers." The tunic is as modified for trench warfare. Regular tunic had modifications done by regimental tailors so troopers wouldn't get their belt caught on barbed wire, while crawling under. This is the centennial of WWI in Europe, America didn't official enter until 1917, which was delayed by the horrendous flu epidemic that killed so many US soldiers in training camps. These WWI German tunics are rare following the fire bombings by US & British Air Corps of cities like Dresden during WW2, where mostly citizens and refugees had fled. We allies have our little told dirty stories unlike the bombing of London. This tunic was originally sewn for a US size 44 chest. It was modified to fit a smaller soldier, as uniforms were recycled as soldiers died. It is currently about a US size 40, but the great news is that the tailor was wise enough to leave the extra material folded back when down sized. That is a bonus for anyone looking to find a large original tunic. The model of the tunic is M1915, which was simplified and had the hidden buttons unlike the prior models. Most collectors are holding onto their uniforms as the prices are soaring, but this is a spare tunic for me. This would look great in your man cave, and no the Prussian picklehaube is not included.

Interchangeable Parts

The back strap, magazine release button, slide catch, and hammer unit mechanism are all interchangeable with a variety of options. The back strap comes in slim, standard and oversized varieties. Px4 Subcompact

Px4 Compact

The Beretta Px4 Storm Compact is sized between the full size and subcompact models and employs a rotating barrel design of the full size pistols, but with a shorter and proportioned slide and grip. This model also introduces an ambidextrous slide stop lever, and a high magazine capacity.

The Joint Combat Pistol
